test-case.description: Reverse a sequence of several items (for a change...)

test-case.description: Reverse an empty sequence

test-case.description: Reverse sequence of nodes on the ancestor axis

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `reverse()`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `reverse(1, 2)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(reverse(()))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(empty(reverse((1))))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(reverse(()))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(exists(reverse(())))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `exists(reverse((1)))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-8
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `reverse((1, current-time())[1])`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-9
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `exists(reverse((1, 2, 3)))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-10
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(reverse((1, 2, 3)))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-11
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(reverse((1, 2, 3)))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-12
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((3, 2, 1), reverse(1 to 3))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-13
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((3, 2, 1), reverse((1, 2, 3)))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqReverseFunc-15
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `reverse(error())`.

test-case.description: Apply a predicate to the result of fn:reverse().

test-case.description: Apply fn:reverse() on a node sequence.

test-case.name: K2-SeqReverseFunc-2
test-case.description: Apply a confusing amount of ordered/unordered{} expressions.

test-case.name: K2-SeqReverseFunc-3
test-case.description: Apply fn:unordered() to fn:reverse().
test-case.test: declare variable $myVar := unordered(fn:reverse((<a/>, <b/>))); deep-equal($myVar, (<a/>, <b/>)) or deep-equal($myVar, (<b/>, <a/>))

test-case.name: K2-SeqReverseFunc-4
test-case.description: fn:reverse() takes only one argument.

test-case.name: K2-SeqReverseFunc-5
test-case.description: fn:reverse() takes one argument.

test-case.name: K2-SeqReverseFunc-6
test-case.description: Combine unordered declaration with fn:reverse().

test-case.name: cbcl-reverse-1
test-case.description: Test condition "If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned."
